issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Make sure error codes are compatible with EC2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When executing euca-create-volume with an invalid availability zone, a malformed error is returned.

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-create-volume -s 2 -z money

CreateVolumeType: java.util.NoSuchElementException: 
example: [Partition name=money pemCertificate=null 
pemNodeCertificate=null pemPrivateKey=null pemNodePrivateKey=null 
id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null 
lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
{code}

Based upon behavior and error code of AWS EC2, we should return InvalidZone.NotFound.

{code}
$ ec2-create-volume -s 2 -z money
Client.InvalidZone.NotFound: The zone 'money' does not exist.
{code}

*Reference*

* http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html
fields.summary: euca-create-volume against an invalid availability zone returns bogus error

comments.body: Starting investigation.  Will provide debugging output from Eucalyptus and AWS.

Confirmed. The error for this is now:

{code}
#
# euca-create-volume -z asdf -s 1
euca-create-volume: error (InvalidZone.NotFound): The zone 'asdf' does not exist.
#
#
{code}
